headline.main: LEHMAN GIVES RULE FOR FOREIGN RELIEF; Says Aid Will Be Reasonable and Place Least Possible Burden on Americans

lead_paragraph: SWARTHMORE, Pa., May 31 -- Livestock herds in general in Europe have decreased so much that five or six years will be required to restore them to pre-war levels, Herbert H. Lehman, director of the Office of Foreign Relief and Rehabilitation Operations, declared today in an address at Swarthmore College's commencement exercises.
